H0.text: Minerals are the substances that plants produce during photosynthesis, the process that Andre learned enables plants to survive.

H1.text: Nitrogen is the substance that plants produce during photosynthesis, a process that allows them to survive.

H2.text: Soil is the substance that plants produce during photosynthesis, as Andre learned that plants survive through this process.

H3.text: Sugar is the substance that plants produce during photosynthesis, a process Andre learned plants use to survive.

A4.text: Photosynthetic organisms store the converted chemical energy within the bonds of intracellular organic compounds (complex compounds containing carbon), typically carbohydrates like sugars (mainly glucose, fructose and sucrose), starches, phytoglycogen and cellulose.

A5.text: After noticing that the soil mass changed very little, he hypothesized that the mass of the growing plant must come from the water, the only substance he added to the potted plant.
